intro: Henckelia pagonensis, commonly known as the Pagona orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually elongated and grass-like, while its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from rocky substrates. Due to its unique appearance and limited habitat, Henckelia pagonensis is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
